item.text: The Lord visited Sarah just as he had said he would and did for Sarah what he had promised.

So <st data-num="08283" class="">Sarah</st> <st data-num="02029" class="">became pregnant</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> a <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> in his <st data-num="02208" class="">old age</st> at the <st data-num="04150" class="">appointed time</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> had <st data-num="01696 0854">told</st> him.

<st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> <st data-num="07121 08034">named</st> his <st data-num="01121 03205">son</st>—<st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="08283" class="">Sarah</st> <st data-num="03205" class="">bore</st> to him—<st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st>.<n id="1" />

When his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st> was <st data-num="08083" class="">eight</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">old</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> <st data-num="04135" class="">circumcised</st> him just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> had <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st> him to do.<n id="2" />
(Now Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.)
Sarah said, “God has made me laugh. Everyone who hears about this will laugh with me.”
She went on to say, “Who would have said to Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have given birth to a son for him in his old age!”
The child grew and was weaned. Abraham prepared a great feast on the day that Isaac was weaned.

But <st data-num="08283" class="">Sarah</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">noticed</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01904" class="">Hagar</st> the <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptian</st>—the son <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> Hagar had <st data-num="03205" class="">borne</st> to <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>—<st data-num="06711" class="">mocking</st>.<n id="2" />
So she said to Abraham, “Banish that slave woman and her son, for the son of that slave woman will not be an heir along with my son Isaac!”
Sarah’s demand displeased Abraham greatly because Ishmael was his son.

But <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>, “Do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> be <st data-num="07489 05869 ">upset</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">about</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">boy</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">or</st> your <st data-num="0519" class="">slave wife</st>. <st data-num="08085 06963">Do</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="08283" class="">Sarah</st> is <st data-num="0559 0413">telling</st><n id="3" /> you <st data-num="03588" class="">because</st> through <st data-num="03327" class="">Isaac</st> your <st data-num="02233" class="">descendants</st> will be <st data-num="07121" class="">counted</st>.<n id="4" />
But I will also make the son of the slave wife into a great nation, for he is your descendant too.”

Early in the morning Abraham took some food and a skin of water and gave them to Hagar. He put them on her shoulders, gave her the child, and sent her away. So she went wandering aimlessly through the wilderness of Beer Sheba.

When the <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="02573" class="">skin</st> <st data-num="03615" class="">was gone</st>, she <st data-num="07993" class="">shoved</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03206" class="">child</st> <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="07880" class="">shrubs</st>.

Then she went and sat down by herself across from him at quite a distance, about a bowshot, away; for she thought, “I refuse to watch the child die.” So she sat across from him and wept uncontrollably.
But God heard the boy’s voice. The angel of God called to Hagar from heaven and asked her, “What is the matter, Hagar? Don’t be afraid, for God has heard the boy’s voice right where he is crying.

<st data-num="06965" class="">Get up</st>! <st data-num="05375" class="">Help</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">boy</st> <st data-num="05375" class="">up</st> and <st data-num="02388" class="">hold</st> him by the <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I will <st data-num="07760" class="">make</st> him into a <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st> <st data-num="01471" class="">nation</st>.”
Then God enabled Hagar to see a well of water. She went over and filled the skin with water, and then gave the boy a drink.
God was with the boy as he grew. He lived in the wilderness and became an archer.
He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother found a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
At that time Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, said to Abraham, “God is with you in all that you do.
Now swear to me right here in God’s name that you will not deceive me, my children, or my descendants. Show me, and the land where you are staying, the same loyalty that I have shown you.”
Abraham said, “I swear to do this.”

But <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> <st data-num="03198" class="">lodged a complaint against</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="040" class="">Abimelech</st> <st data-num="05921 0182">concerning</st> a <st data-num="0875 04325">well</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="040" class="">Abimelech’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> had <st data-num="01497" class="">seized</st>.<n id="3" />
“I do not know who has done this thing,” Abimelech replied. “Moreover, you did not tell me. I did not hear about it until today.”
Abraham took some sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech. The two of them made a treaty.

Then <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st> <st data-num="05324" class="">set</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03535" class="">ewe lambs</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">apart</st> from the <st data-num="06629" class="">flock</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">by</st> themselves.

<st data-num="040" class="">Abimelech</st> <st data-num="0559 0413">asked</st> <st data-num="085" class="">Abraham</st>, “<st data-num="04100" class="">What</st> is the <st data-num="02007" class="">meaning</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03535" class="">ewe lambs</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> you have <st data-num="05324" class="">set</st> <st data-num="0905" class="">apart</st>?”

He <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st>, “You <st data-num="03588" class="">must</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st> these <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03535" class="">ewe lambs</st> from my <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> <st data-num="05668 01961">as</st> <st data-num="05713" class="">legal proof</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> I <st data-num="02658" class="">dug</st> <st data-num="02063" class="">this</st> <st data-num="0875" class="">well</st>.”<n id="2" />
That is why he named that place Beer Sheba, because the two of them swore an oath there.
So they made a treaty at Beer Sheba; then Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, returned to the land of the Philistines.
Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beer Sheba. There he worshiped the Lord, the eternal God.
So Abraham stayed in the land of the Philistines for quite some time.
